messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

(Sc3N2)2(Sc2N)2Sc29N28 crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one Sc29N28 sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction; two Sc2N sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction; and two Sc3N2 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. In the Sc29N28 sheet, there are eight inequivalent Sc sites. In the first Sc site, Sc(6) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(4) atoms. All Sc(6)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.15 Å. In the second Sc site, Sc(7) is bonded to three equivalent N(4) and three equivalent N(6) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 4°. All Sc(7)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.36 Å. All Sc(7)-N(6) bond lengths are 2.20 Å. In the third Sc site, Sc(8) is bonded to three equivalent N(5) and three equivalent N(6) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 2-4°. All Sc(8)-N(5) bond lengths are 2.24 Å. All Sc(8)-N(6) bond lengths are 2.31 Å. In the fourth Sc site, Sc(9) is bonded to three equivalent N(5) and three equivalent N(7) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 1-2°. All Sc(9)-N(5) bond lengths are 2.29 Å. All Sc(9)-N(7) bond lengths are 2.25 Å. In the fifth Sc site, Sc(10) is bonded to three equivalent N(7) and three equivalent N(8) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-1°. All Sc(10)-N(7) bond lengths are 2.28 Å. All Sc(10)-N(8) bond lengths are 2.26 Å. In the sixth Sc site, Sc(11) is bonded to three equivalent N(8) and three equivalent N(9) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Sc(11)-N(8) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. All Sc(11)-N(9) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. In the seventh Sc site, Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20) is bonded to three equivalent N(10,11,12,13,14,15,16) and three equivalent N(9) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20)-N(10,11,12,13,14,15,16) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. All Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20)-N(9) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. In the eighth Sc site, Sc(19) is bonded to three equivalent N(10,11,12,13,14,15,16) and three equivalent N(17) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Sc(19)-N(10,11,12,13,14,15,16) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. All Sc(19)-N(17) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. There are eight inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(4) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(6) and three equivalent Sc(7) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 6°. In the second N site, N(5) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(8) and three equivalent Sc(9) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 1-3°. In the third N site, N(6) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(7) and three equivalent Sc(8) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 3-6°. In the fourth N site, N(7) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(10) and three equivalent Sc(9) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 1°. In the fifth N site, N(8) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(10) and three equivalent Sc(11) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-1°. In the sixth N site, N(9) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(11) and three equivalent Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the seventh N site, N(10,11,12,13,14,15,16) is bonded to six equivalent Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the eighth N site, N(17) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20) and three equivalent Sc(19) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All N(17)-Sc(12,13,14,15,16,17,18,20) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. In each Sc2N sheet, there are two inequivalent Sc sites. In the first Sc site, Sc(4) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(3) atoms. All Sc(4)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.22 Å. In the second Sc site, Sc(5) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(3) atoms. All Sc(5)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.22 Å. N(3) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(4) and three equivalent Sc(5) atoms to form edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. In each Sc3N2 sheet, there are three inequivalent Sc sites. In the first Sc site, Sc(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Sc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.18 Å. In the second Sc site, Sc(2) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. All Sc(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.30 Å. All Sc(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.30 Å. In the third Sc site, Sc(3) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(2) atoms. All Sc(3)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.18 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(1) and three equivalent Sc(2) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to three equivalent Sc(2) and three equivalent Sc(3) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.953534321849315 eV/atom.

ScN is Zincblende, Sphalerite structured and crystallizes in the cubic F-43m space group. Sc(1) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing ScN4 tetrahedra. All Sc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.12 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Sc(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NSc4 tetrahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 2.4152 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.789021039999999 eV/atom.

ScN is Tetraauricupride structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. Sc(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. All Sc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.42 Å. N(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent Sc(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.059685245 eV/atom.

ScN is Halite, Rock Salt structured and crystallizes in the cubic Fm-3m space group. Sc(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing ScN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Sc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.26 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Sc(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NSc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -2.092353565 eV/atom.
